title: Technical and administrative assistant
description:
The Luxembourg Maritime Administration, with a diversified fleet of tankers, container ships, passenger vessels, dredgers and small commercial vessels is looking for a: Technical and administrative assistant




What we are looking for:

A professional who can provide technical support related to the acquisition, storage and processing of data on ship structures, delivering effective solutions for internal and external clients within defined parameters.

The candidates must possess strong technical expertise and sound knowledge of relevant international and European maritime laws and regulations, as well as a good background in industry or government service.

He/She should hold a diploma issued by a recognized higher school of navigation, certifying the successful completion of a master's degree or equivalent.

Missions:

 * Assist the Government Commissioner for maritime affairs in accomplishing his tasks and advise him on maritime matters;
 * Handle nautical and technical issues arising from shipowners, classification societies, or maritime organizations;
 * Ensure compliance with Luxembourg legislation on ships flying the Luxembourg flag;
 * Monitor the performance of ships under the Luxembourg flag;
 * Represent Luxembourg at meetings in International and European bodies;
 * Follow up and evaluate the tasks performed by various organizations authorized to carry out tasks on behalf of Luxembourg Maritime Administration.

Profile

Technical skills

 * Nautical experience required as an officer on a sea-going vessel for a minimum of five years, or in a classification society.
 * Good command of English and French;
 * Analytical and writing skills;
 * Methodical and rigorous work;
 * Good knowledge of common IT tools.

Behavioral skills

 * Sense of organization and responsibility;
 * Active listening and customer orientation, interpersonal skills;
 * Ability to work independently as well as in a team;
 * Availability and flexibility (on-call, meetings abroad, etc.).

Assets:

 * Pleasure craft license

Admission conditions

State employee position

Get more details about the admission conditions for state employees.

https://govjobs.public.lu/fr/votre-carriere/statut-agents/employes-etat/conditions-admission.html

Languages

To qualify for the A1 indemnity group, you need to demonstrate knowledge of three administrative languages. However, an exemption from two of these languages may be granted under certain conditions. Nationality:

You are a national of a European Union member state.

Documents to provide

Cover letter, copy of the diploma, CV detailing the following information:

 * Name(s) and first name(s)
 * Identification number (i.e., the national registration number or, if not available, the date of birth)
 * Nationality
 * Email address
 * List of educational institutions attended and their country of location (please indicate the full name of the institutions, abbreviations are not permitted)
 * Diplomas (please state the titles of the diplomas)
 * Professional experience
 * Knowledge of spoken and written languages

If you are interested in this position, please apply by 01/08/2025, submitting your CV, diploma and cover letter.

Applications for this position must be made online via:

https://govjobs.public.lu/fr/postuler/postes-ouverts/postes-vacants/employes/2025/A1/Juillet/20250704-assistanttechniqueetadministra-377390.html

Applications by email or post will not be accepted. Documents should be submitted in PDF format.

More information about this job?

Contact: Mr. Jonathan SCHMIT

 Email: rh@cam.etat.lu

Tel.: +352 247- 84454

Website: https://maritime.public.lu/en.html
